title: new Xerox sans
content:
Evening everyone. Any idea what this one is?

It's also all over [http://xerox.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019155217/http:/xerox.com/)

Regards,

Trev

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [xlogo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019155217/http:/typophile.com/files/xlogo.gif) | 3.56 KB |
author: Trevor Curtis

comments.content:
Hi Trevor,

check out [this thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019155217/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40625) (you can [search typophile](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019155217/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20xerox)):

It’s a custom version of [FS Albert](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019155217/http:/www.fontsmith.com/news.php?id=509) for Xerox, by Fontsmith.  
F
Thanks Florian. That's strange, I did a search just before posting, and didn't see any results from the "ID" section. Must have missed it somehow.
No problem. The built-in search doesn’t really work, you have to use Google & al.
Noted. I will consult Mr. Goog next time. I've only just noticed the Xerox branding now, the type looks nice (better in the logo than the headers, though).
